intro: Fleischmannia valerioana, commonly known as the Desert Evening Primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Fleischmannia valerioana is adapted to survive in harsh desert conditions, with deep roots that help it access water from deeper soil layers.
